content: happy house charm about the pattern the happy house charm is worked from the bottom up on circular needles using the magic loop method you can also use dnps but i found the magic loop method to be a bit easier for this project the happy house charm is intended to be a scrap project suitable for any gauge/any yarn you have le� over feel free to adjust the stitch counts to create the happy house charm of your dreams materials 3 5 mm circular needles or whatever needle size matches your scrap yarn tapestry needle stitch marker fiber fill or scrap yarn/fabric ~ 15 g of main color yarn ~ 10 g of secondary color yarn note because this is a scrap yarn project your yarn requirements will vary based on what yarn and needle size you use happy house construction body cast on 12 stitches using judy s magic cast on you should end up with 12 stitches on each needle place marker at beginning of round work in stockinette stitch for 14 row or to your desired length break the main color yarn attach the secondary color yarn knit 2 rounds stuff the body with yarn/fabric scraps or fiber fill roof divide stitches evenly between both needles n1 and n2 r1 n1 k1 ssk k until 3 before the end of n1 k2tog k1 n2 repeat n1 r2 n1 & n2 knit to end of row work r1-r2 until 4 stitches remain on each needle r3 n1 k1 k2tog k1 n2 repeat n1 break the yarn but leave the stitches on the needle finish stuffing the house with yarn/fabric scraps or fiber fill icord/braid work an icord or a braid and tie off at the end to create a loop place the knot inside the top of the house concealing it cast off the house with the knot tucked inside by threading your working yarn through a tapestry needle and weaving it through the live stitches pull tight and weave inside door and window using duplicate stitch add a door and window to the front of the house according to the chart and written instructions below count 5 stitches in from edge of house on each side using duplicate stitch add secondary color to the 2 stitches in the middle continue upward for three more stitches above each 1 row over create a square shape for the window at the height of your choice i usually place mine 2-3 row below the start of the roof attach your happy house charm to the bag of your choice o your bag h t & c e a n t j t o a y i can t wait to see your happy houses use the hashtag #happyhousecharm to share your creations feel free to contact me on insta @karebearknits or via email at karebearknits@gmail com if you have any questions happy knitting this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the
